fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the *Organisation* field is not available in the Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the Organisation field as an option in the Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget
h3. Why this is important

Customer would want to see report per based on the Organisation
h3. Workaround

(Optional)

 
{panel:title=Update 24th November 2020}
We appreciate the merit of this issue, but don't intend to work it in the foreseeable future. We'll review it again within a year to see if our decision has changed.  

Thanks, 
JSM Team.
{panel}
fields.summary: Add the Organisation field as an option in the Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Custom fields randomly are not carrying the default value over to the customer portal.  The default value is shown in JIRA and when creating issues from inside JIRA.  This seems to only effect numeric values containing .'s.
 * After changing the value to an integer (3), the default value was shown *correctly*
 * After adding a string character to the value (3.0 x), the default value was shown *correctly*
 * After changing the value back to a decimal (3.0), the default value was no longer shown again

h4. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom Select List (cascading)
 # Add a default value to that field with a ., I.E. 3.0
 # Add the field to a screen used by a Service Desk project
 # Add that field to a Service Desk request type
 # Bring up the create screen for that request

h4. Expected Results

Default value will be displayed in the Customer Portal
h4. Actual Results

The text field populates the default value, the numeric value is not populated.  There are other custom fields of this same type that are properly populating their fields.
h4. Notes

This seems similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1967
fields.summary: Custom field default value not showing in Customer Portal

fields.description:
The potential customer should be able to send us an email to create a ticket without having a customer registration. They will then receive the instructions and link for registering for a customer account. Once they have completed that process, the user would be flagged as a pending customer and we would be notified of this request for registration. It would then be up to the agents for the project to approve or deny this request. The user shouldn’t be able to access our customer portal until their registration request is approved.

 The reason that we want to have this feature is that we like the fact that anybody can email a support request since their exposure is limited to our support channel for that single ticket and we can evaluate that ticket’s validity before granting customer access. One example of this is if we wanted to issue a maintenance announcement to our customer base in Jira. We wouldn’t want just anyone being able to create an account and potentially see sensitive information until they have been vetted and their customer registration approved.
fields.summary: Please provide a method to approve a customer registration prior to giving them access.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Blank page is shown when users accessing Customer Portal through IE 11.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Access the customer portal with IE 11

h3. Actual Result

It shows blank page.

h3. Expected Result

Customer Portal is shown properly.

h3. Workaround

Use other browser (ie. Chrome, Firefox)
fields.summary: Unable to access Customer Portal in IE 11

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently, there isn't a way to change the column format of the knowledge base in the customer portal.

*Suggested Solution*

Make it possible to configure the column format of the knowledge base in the customer portal to make it appears as large as it is in Confluence.

*Why this is important*

Some users would find it easier to visualize the page in a bigger format.
fields.summary: Knowledge base column format

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, even if the customer is added in more than one organization, when creating a new request it's only possible to share with one organization.

_PS: after the ticket created, it's possible to edit the field Organizations and add more organizations._

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the user to select the organizations he want to share that ticket he's creating.
fields.summary: Allow user to select more than one organization when creating a request

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Currently, there isn't a way to set two spaces as a knowledge base in the same JIRA Service Desk project.

*Suggested Solution*

Make it possible to set more than one space as a knowledge base in the same JIRA Service Desk project.

*Why this is important*

Some users can find it very useful to set different knowledge bases for customer and agents, for example.
fields.summary: Ability to set more than one knowledge base in the same project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently , SLA configuration for hour (ч) is not working for Russian language. 
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.1196.0



h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to SLA page.
 # Configure the time as below !Screen Shot 2017-04-24 at 3.39.04 PM.png!

h3. Expected Results

Able to save it.
h3. Actual Results

Hit below error :-

Цели могут оставаться пустыми, или их необходимо определить в соответствии со следующим форматом: 4 часа 30 минут

Meaning : Goals may remain empty, or they must be determined in accordance with the following format: 4 hours 30 minutes
h3.  
h3. Workaround
 # Go to User Profile
 # Change Preferences language to *English (UK)*
 # Then , go back to SLA page and edit the time . Then update it.
 # Then , change back the profile language to Russian.
fields.summary: Russian language is not working to configure (hour) for SLA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

As an agent, I would like to notify Service Desk customer when transitioning to certain status and at the same time, giving an update about completion/finishing date by selecting date from JIRA custom field.

Based on the current [Customer Notification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/managing-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html] setting, there is no way to achieve that.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to add JIRA custom field in customer notification
fields.summary: Provide a feature to add JIRA custom field in customer notification

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently the customer portal is only configurable per project. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the ability to customize the portal up to customers or organizations. 
h3. Why this is important
 Allows for more granularity and a personalized interface.
fields.summary: Customize portal per user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Delete the sample 9-5 calendar of the SLA cause users to don’t be able to create new SLA Goals
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud v1000.892.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set SLA goals using the sample 9-5 calendar

 # Delete the default sample 9-5 calendar of a service desk project

 # All the SLA Goals will be automatically changed to 24/7 calendar (default)

 # Create new SLA goals and save it

 
h3. Expected Results

You should be able to create new SLA Goals
h3. Actual Results

It doesn’t save the SLA goals. It only refreshes the page without any error message.

 
h3. Workaround:

Manually change all SLA goals to a different calendar and change it again to the correct calendar.
fields.summary: Delete the sample 9-5 calendar of the SLA cause users to not be able to create new SLA Goals

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
We would like to prevent that service desk sends email receipts to certain email accounts, as the receipt will trigger another receipt and start a loop.

h3. Suggested Solution
Have a Suppress Customer Notification option on a Restricted portal user
fields.summary: Have a Suppress Customer Notification option on a Restricted portal user

fields.description:
When trying to create a Service Desk project under certain circumstances, creating the project will fail and an exception will be logged. This will occur if a JIRA Service Desk project is deleted while JIRA Service Desk is deactivated/unlicensed because portals for the project are not fully removed from the database. Later, if we re-license JSD and try to create a project with the same key, the failure will occur.
h1. Steps to reproduce

1. Create a new service desk project called 'Support'
 2. Update your license to only have JIRA Core (i.e. deactivate Service Desk)
 3. Delete the 'Support' project
 4. Delete all of the issue types that came from service desk (IT Help, Service Request, Service Request with Approvals, possibly others depending on project template)
 5. Update your license to include service desk again
 6. Create a new project 'Support' (it just needs to have the same project key as the original project)
 7. Creating the project will fail, if you check the logs you will get the stacktrace with the Postgres exception below

 

You can check the all events on Splunk [logs|https://splunk.atlassian.io/en-US/app/search/search?q=search%20eventtype%3D%22unicorn_jira%22%20prd-safe%20env%3Dprd-safe%20ERROR%20ProjectCreateRegistrarImpl%20level%3DERROR%20%20%22err.msg%22%3D%22Caught%20PSQLException%20for%20delete%20from%20%5C%22public%5C%22.%5C%22AO_54307E_GROUP%5C%22%20where%20%5C%22AO_54307E_GROUP%5C%22.%5C%22VIEWPORT_ID%5C%22%20%3D%20%3F%22&earliest=-7d%40h&latest=now&display.page.search.mode=verbose&dispatch.sample_ratio=1&sid=1492667407.1405141_0C564095-03C1-4E8A-A6D9-A914C0CE98BE]

fields.description: Hi, some additions for this issue (JSDSERVER-1663). Why it is not possible to manage My requests page by admin to include different fields presented on the request form into the filter. My customers would like to see not all requests but to filter by versions, components etc. It will be fine to develop My requests page by admin like different Queues filters are developed
fields.summary: My requests page configuring by admin

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When requesting issues on behalf of customers, agents are required to add the user to an organization manually before/after creating the request
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow adding the customer to the organization directly while creating/editing the request
h3. Why this is important
Agents need to manually add the customers to the organization and if the agent forgets to do so, customers would not be added to the organization
fields.summary: Automatically add customers to organization upon creating issues on behalf of customers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The header color of Customer Portal remains the default settings after changed. This problem occurs only in Vertigo instances.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Click on cog icon > Applications > JIRA Service Desk Configuration > View and customize 
# Change the color of header bar 
# Click Save Changes
# The color will change in preview mode, but when you refresh the page, the color return to default settings
# Go back to the Customize screen and the header bar session will be set with the custom configuration, but the bar will remain with the default settings.
fields.summary: Header color of Customer Portal does not change in Vertigo instances
Confluence only users not getting invitation email when added to a Service Desk project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

There were some cases were customers were trying to import from JIRA Server with Service Desk installed to a JIRA Cloud -without Service Desk- and an error to upgrade would occur (may happened even if Cloud has SD installed).

We could replicate this in a clean Cloud instance with an export file from a clean JIRA 7.3.0 e SDS 3.3.0 Server.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import from JIRA SD Server to Cloud
 # Import to a JIRA Cloud without SD installed.

h3. Expected Results

Either the import will work without the SD features or a warning will be shown that the user has to install SD first.

h3. Workaround

-This issue is caused by upgrade tasks in Service Desk for JIRA Server 3.3.0 not having corresponding downgrade tasks.- The workaround is to run the following query in JIRA Server's database (take a database backup first) then immediately run another export. If JIRA is restarted in between the SQL command and taking the backup, the upgrade tasks are re-run again and this process needs to be repeated.
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM upgradetaskhistory WHERE upgrade_task_factory_key = 'com.atlassian.servicedesk';
{code}
This will be fixed in an upcoming release of Service Desk Cloud.
fields.summary: SD upgrade task is causing failure in import to JIRA Cloud from Server

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Create Issue trigger doesn't work in automation when a Custom Event is set on the create transition.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the event of the create issue transition to a custom event
 # Create an automation where the trigger is "Issue created".
 # Create an issue and the automation will not be executed for this issue, also it won't show the issue on the Automation logs.

h3. Expected Results

The automation execute properly, in case it fails it should at least show the reason of the failure on the automation log.
h3. Actual Results

The automation isn't triggered and nothing is shown in the automation logs.
h3. Solution

If you want to use a custom event, make sure it inherits its event type from "Issue created".
fields.summary: Automation isn't triggered by Create Issue trigger when a custom event is set in the create issue transition.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Reports showing years are showing the incorrect number of issues when drilling down into the data.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Data needs to be collected over many months to see the inconsistencies. 
# View a report showing past year by month
# Click on the number for the month to expand the details

h3. Expected Results
The number of issues for the month should for the calendar month. For example, March should return back all the results from March. If 3 issues are shown for March, 3 issues should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
Issues from February are included in March on the drilled down data, instead of 3 issues being shown 4 are displayed.
 
h3. Notes
When using month this results in something like:
February 2017 is selected
Period calculated as March 2016 - February 2017
When calculating from this the start and end date for only February it uses the interval duration from first month, which is March.
The problem is that March has more days than February, so it comes up with a period overflowing into March.
The problem is even worse for January, as the code somehow calculated 1 December to 1 30 January as the period, since January has 31 days so it ends up in November before flattening that to the start of the month 

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Report Drilldown calculating incorrect period by month

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently , admin still can choose *Send Email* action to *Customer Involved* when *Comment Visibility is Internal* is configured. Technically , customer couldn't get notified when comment is internal because only JIRA user can view the comment via JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution

Remove selection for Customer Involved if Send Email action is configure.

h3. Why this is important

This may confuse admin and thought it should work , but in reality it will not work.
fields.summary: Remove Send Email action to Customer Involved for Automation when Comment Visibility is Internal

fields.description:
Email notification attachment URLs for logged out users result in 404s after logging in when Atlassian Account is enabled

 

*Steps to reproduce*

1. Log in to an AA-enabled instance as an admin
 2. Invite an agent to your project, e.g. mpalmer+testing@atlassian.com (just needs to be somewhere you can access email notifications)
 3. Create a request via the customer portal
 4. Add mpalmer+testing@atlassian.com as a request participant/watcher
 5. Add a comment with an attachment to the request
 6. mpalmer+testing@atlassian.com will be emailed a notification for the comment with a link to the attachment
 7. Log out of JIRA
 8. Click the link in the notification in the email, you will get asked to log in
 9. After logging in, you are redirected to a URL where the file cannot be found

 

*Expected behaviour*

I should be redirected to a URL where the file exists after logging in

 

*Notes for Support*

The link in the email will be of the following format
{noformat}
https://<JIRA-INSTANCE>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/10004/10004_Screen+Shot+2017-03-21+at+10.35.49+AM.png?fromIssue=10006{noformat}
and after you login you will get redirected to (/servicedesk/customer would get appended to the url after the instance name)
{noformat}
https://<JIRA-INSTANCE>/servicedesk/customer//servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/10004/10004_Screen+Shot+2017-03-21+at+10.35.49+AM.png?fromIssue=10006{noformat}
 

*Workaround*

If you are already logged into JIRA; then the link to the attachment will load correctly.
fields.summary: Email notification attachment URLs result in 404s for logged out users when Atlassian Account is enabled

Customer have to know the full e-mail of another customer to share the ticket

h3. Suggestion
Add a preview, as agents have on Service Desk, for the customers.

h3. Workarounds
None
fields.summary: Let customer preview other customer in Customer Portal when sharing

fields.description:
h3. Problem

As part of the identity platform migration, Service Desk portal only customers were separated from the Atlassian Account users into a separate user base. The administration of the two types of users is now separated out as well, with Atlassian Account users being listed under "User Management" and portal only customers under "JIRA Service Desk". The "Administer User" option inside the profile tools in JIRA hasn't been updated to reflect this change and as a result the user taken to the wrong place when attempting to administer a portal only customer.

!administer-user-action.png|thumbnail!   !invalid-user-message.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Go to the "Portal only customers" section under JIRA Service Desk in site administration and search for the email address there

!portal-only-user-search.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: "Administer User" link points to wrong administration url for portal only users

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a Service Desk SLA is created with a Special Character in its name, the SLA Goals Report shows "No Issues" despite issues meeting the SLA Goal

* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "Link" button is being cut from layout in a JIRA Service Desk project settings

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JIRA Service Desk project.
 # Go to Project Settings > Knowledge base
There you should see a sliver of the "Link" button, like in the screenshot below:

!Screen Shot 2017-04-09 at 11.43.21 AM.png|thumbnail!

If you click on "Link to a Confluence space", then click back on "Don't link to a Confluence space" the layout is fixed and the button disappear.
Also, even if you link the project to a Confluence space, the button top of the button appears anyway:

  !Screen Shot 2017-04-09 at 11.59.06 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

If you haven't linked the project to a Confluence space, the button should be hidden.
h3. Notes

The problem was reproducible on Chrome Version 57.0.2987.133 and Firefox 52.0.2 while using Mac OS X and while using Windows 10 and IE 11.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: The "Link" button in Project Settings > Knowledge base is being cut from display

fields.description:
*Summary*

Customer notifications are sent in English when you have more than one language enabled, even though the default language is not English.

*Steps to Reproduce*

Access the Project settings and go to Customer notifications>Manage languages set e.g. Portuguese as the default language and enable other languages too. Create a test issue in the customer portal.

*Expected Results*

Notification about issue creation comes in Portuguese.

*Actual Results*

Notification about issue creation comes in English.

*Workaround*

Keep only the default language enabled and disable all the other languages.
fields.summary: Notifications not being sent in the default language

fields.description:
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud Version: 1000.885.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Please note that this does not occur for every user*
 # Log into Cloud instance with user experiencing the issue (with either basic authentication or via UM - Login as User)
 # Navigate a JSD project: Top menu > Project > Service Desk > Click on a SD project
 # Unable to navigate to the Main Project Page: https://<EXAMPLE>.atlassian.net/browse/<EXAMPLE-KEY>

h3. Expected Results

To be able to access the Project Page
h3. Actual Results

!example.png|thumbnail!

In Chrome:
{code:java}
This page isn’t working

<example>.atlassian.net redirected you too many times.
Try clearing your cookies.
ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS

Reload
{code}
h3. Workaround
 * Paste the JIRA Service Desk project queues URL to a new browser tab: {{<example>.atlassian.net/projects/<jira_service_desk_project_key>/queues}} . For example: {{domain.atlassian.net/projects/CORE/queues}}. After that you won't see the error again when you access the project from the project list.
fields.summary: User accessing JIRA Service Desk Cloud project results in ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to raise an issue in Service Desk Portal when there is a multiple choice field using Internet Explorer 11
h3. Environment

JIRA v1000.885.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Internet Explorer 11, go to JIRA Service Desk Portal
 # Create issue
 # Fill up the fields
 # Mark the checkbox in the multiple choice field
 # Hit 'Create Issue'

h3. Expected Results

The issue has been created successfully.
h3. Actual Results

There is an error in the multiple choice field and the issue cannot be created:
 * "Please provide a valid value for field"

h3. Workaround

Use another web browser
fields.summary: Unable to raise an issue when there is a multiple choice field using Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On IE 11 or Microsoft Edge, it is not possible to create tickets when there's a checkbox custom field.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a request type with checkbox custom field
# Create a ticket with that custom type on IE 11

h3. Expected Result
Ticket is created.

h3. Actual result
It shows error:
{quote}
Please provide a valid value for field '<custom field name>'
{quote}

h3. Notes
* This also happens even the field is set to optional/mandatory
* This does not happen on other browsers

h3.Workaround
* Use different browser to create tickets.
fields.summary: Checkbox Custom Fields Not Working on Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When an administrator is searching for users or groups to add to roles within a JIRA Service Desk project from the "[JIRA Service Desk Project] > Project Settings > Users and Roles" page, groups and users may not be found, and therefore can't be added to a role.

*Example:*
Available groups: testgroup, Testgroup2, TestGRoup3 - ideally all 3 groups should appear when searching variations of "testgroup". Searching partial strings with incorrect case doesn't yield favorable results.

 

!Screen Shot 2017-04-05 at 7.29.22 PM.png|width=241,height=213!!Screen Shot 2017-04-05 at 7.26.58 PM.png|width=286,height=219!!Screen Shot 2017-04-05 at 7.26.38 PM.png|width=228,height=225!!image-2017-04-05-20-59-42-745.png|width=240,height=190!

 

 
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Improve the way JIRA searches partial strings and
 * Search ignoring case

h3. Why this is important
 * User experience improved through more accurate searching
 

h3. Workaround 

When searching:
 * Match exact case
 * Match search terms to group/user name
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk: Users and Roles - Improving search results for users and groups

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Changing the project type from Service Desk to Software/Business does not remove the service desk on the portal.

h3. Affected Version

- JIRA v1000.883.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Create a new Service Desk project
 # Go to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals
 _Notice that the new service desk is listed on the Service Desk Portal._

 
 # Go to {{Project Settings > Details}}.
 # Change the Service Desk project type to *Software* or *Business*
 # Go to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals
 _Notice that the new service desk that just was changed to software or business project is still listed on the Service Desk Portal._
 
h3. Expected Results

When a project type from a Service Desk project is changed to *Software* or *Business*, it automatically removes the link from the Service Desk Portal.

h3. Actual Results

The service desk that was changed to software or business project is still listed on the Service Desk Portal.
fields.summary: Changing the project type from Service Desk to Software/Business does not remove the service desk on the portal

fields.description: Recent update is shit!
fields.summary: Recent Update

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The customer portal on a JIRA Service Desk project is publically available. On JIRA Service Desk, JIRA accounts without application access to JIRA Service Desk should be flagged and not be given access to the portal.

Three main reasons:
 # Disallow JIRA admins to use this behavior to grant customers "Portal-only access"
 # Create a hard distinction between JIRA/Atlassian account and "Portal-only customers" on JIRA Service Desk.
 # Keeps customers in the "Portal-only customers" page in User Management.

h3. Suggested Solution
 # Flag and restrict customer portal access for JIRA/Atlassian accounts that exist on an instance.
 # Allow the conversion of JIRA/Atlassian account to "Portal-only customers".

h3. Why this is important
 * Keep a level of distinction between JIRA/Atlassian accounts and "Portal-only customers".
 * Encourages admins to create customer accounts in the "Customers" tab from within a given JIRA Service Desk project.

h3. Workaround
 # From within JIRA ADMINISTRATION > User Management. Remove the desired account.
 # Add the customer account from the "Customers" tab within the appropriate JIRA Service Desk Project.
fields.summary: Remove Customer Portal access for Atlassian accounts which don't have application access

The changes will save and successfully configured.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Service Desk fails to process incoming emails if it contains attachments with special characters on file name.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

Customers send email to the Service Desk mail channel.
h3. Expected Results

Ticket gets created or comment added in the relevant Service Desk project ticket.
h3. Actual Results

No ticket or comment is added. The error shown in the processing logs ([https://your_instance_name.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa|https://pwitab.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDMailInfo.jspa] > select *View log* > *Processing log)* is: _Mail handler throws exception: Unexpected error while running action as user 'xxx'_.
h3. Workaround

If you raise a ticket with Support, the support team can try to reprocess the failed email.
fields.summary: Email fails to proccess by Service Desk mail handler

fields.description:
h3. UPDATE: 9th October, 2020



Hello all! I'm happy to share that we have now actively picked up this ticket and will be resolving it shortly. We will provide another update when we're done. 

Cheers,
Jason
h3. Problem Definition

At the create issue screen, on the customer portal, the field *share with* is coming with the default value of an organization instead of *private request*, customers can accidentally share issues that must have restricted access. 

 

Also, when a customer is part of several organizations, the default setting will be *private request*. In some scenarios, customers may want to have the option to select one of their organizations as their default one rather than just private.
h3. Suggested Solutions

Create an option to choose the default value for the field *share with* at the customer portal.
fields.summary: Ability to choose a default setting for Organization sharing at the create issue screen.

h3. Summary

Currently in JIRA Service Desk Cloud, SD agent cannot remove customer from customer list as mentioned in [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/setting-up-service-desk-users-732528877.html] article.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Service Desk Cloud
 * Version 1000.658.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Service Desk project.
 # Verify that there are customers defined in the Customer list of the project.
 # Try to follow the *Remove customers from a project* section in the above documentation article.

h3. Expected Results

Customer get removed from the Customer list.
h3. Actual Results

There are no Service Desk Customers roles defined in the *Users & Roles* page (see screenshot below).
 !2016-12-22_users-roles.png|thumbnail! 
 Agent can only add new customers but there are no ways to remove customer from the Customer list.
fields.summary: Service Desk agent can no longer remove customer from customer list

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA Service Desk Project will stop processing incoming emails sent to the mailbox used by the Service Desk project. Servicedesk is stuck attempting to process a single email. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce:
Cannot be reproduced. 
             
h3. Expected Results:
JIRA Service Desk Project processes incoming email 

h3. Actual Results
Emails don't get processed

h3. Workaround
Please contact Support at support.atlassian.com, the email that JSD's email processor is stuck on needs to be manually downloaded for the customer and marked as ignored in the DB.
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk not processing incoming Email

fields.description:
To reproduce, create a JSD issue and ensure that the reported is also added as a participant. 

h3. Summary
If a user is already a reporter and then added as a request participant, it won't be possible to change the request type (eg: Support Request to IT Request) of the issue.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Request in a Service Desk Project (can be either without a Request Type or with)
# Make sure the reporter of the ticket is also included in the Participants.
# Edit the Request type and select a different Request Type.

h3. Expected Results
The Request type is changed correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Instead the Request type does not change.

Opening the network inspector shows the following in the network tab:
{noformat}
POST to <baseurl>/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/request/109669/request-types
400 bad request

response body:
{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"Failed to validate update parameters of the given request"}],"reasonKey":"com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestUpdateValidationError","reasonCode":"400"}
{noformat}

The Javascript console will show the following:
{noformat}
POST https://invaluable.atlassian.net/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/request/109669/request-types 400 (Bad Request)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Remove the Reporter from the Participants field and edit the issue again.
fields.summary: JSD issue request type can not be changed if reporter is also added as participant

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Search does not work in the single portal and request type suggestions for JSD Cloud with Confluence 5.9.10 due to a change in the REST endpoint used not being handled properly to ensure backwards compatibility.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create an Application link between JSD Cloud instance and Confluence service 5.9.10 instance.
# Configure the link to use OAuth (without impersonation).
# Create a SD Project and link to a Confluence Space
# Search in the individual portal for this project.

h3. Expected behaviour
Search results will be returned matching the search query

h3. Actual behaviour
No search results are returned and an error appears in the console showing a 404 error for <instance-name>jira/rest/servicedesk/knowledgebase/latest/articles/search?project=<project-key>&query=<query>
The same happens in the request type for suggestions as it uses the same search endpoint.

h3. Workaround
Upgrade Confluence to 5.10.0.
fields.summary: Knowledge base search in the single portal and request type suggestions does not work on versions Confluence 5.9.10 and earlier

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

Unable to log out as customer in customer portal using IE 11.

h2. Steps to Reproduce the Issue

# Log in as customer using IE11
# Click on the user avatar at the top right corner and click on {{Log Out}}

h2. Expected Result

Customer logged out

h2. Actual Result

Nothing happened

h2. Workaround

Close the browser or delete the cookie for the session to end. Alternatively, use different browser.

h2. Additional Information

Affected version {{1000.534.0}}
fields.summary: Unable to Log Out as Customer in Customer Portal using IE 11

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project.
# Log out.
# Try to load the URL of one of the Service Desk admin functions ({{/servicedesk/admin/<key>/request-security}} for example)

h3. Expected results
The user is redirected to the login page, then after logging in they're redirected back to the admin page.

h3. Actual results
The user is presented with a message that says:

{quote}
Something seems to have gone wrong

No project could be found with key <key>.
{quote}
fields.summary: Visiting Service Desk project's admin pages when not logged in results in "Something went wrong" message

fields.description:
*Symptom:*
JIRA Service Desk shows the 'My First Service Desk' link and 'Create a Service Desk' link in *Service Desk* drop-down menu in the header. When users click these links, a service desk project is created, but no resolutions are created.

As a result, when users try to resolve issues, there's no resolution available. If users create their own projects from the *Projects* drop-down, resolutions are correctly populated. 

*Fix:*
We'll remove the 'My First Service Desk' link from the drop-down and fix the other one.
fields.summary: No resolutions are created in the system when the first project is created via the *Service Desk* drop down

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, adding agents in Service Desk using *Invite Team* option at the sidebar, displays "reached limit" error despite still having available licenses to add new agents.

Agents can still be added despite the error message. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud version {{7.2.0-OD-05-030}}
* Service Desk version {{3.2.0-OD-08-001-D20160406T042754}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure that there are available licenses for new agents
# Navigate to a service desk project and click the *Invite Team* tab at the side bar

h3. Expected Results
No error message saying limit has been reached for agent licenses.

h3. Actual Results
Error message displayed in the pop-up as per the screen shot: [^invite.png]
 
 !invite.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Agents can still be added despite this message appearing.
* Seems to be only happening for annual licenses only.
fields.summary: Adding agents in Service Desk displays "reached limit" error despite still having available licenses

fields.description:
When clicking the Service Desk Help menu:

!service_desk_help.png!

A "Oops, you've found a dead link."message is displayed:

!dead_link.png!

Here's the URL for the page with the error:

https://domain.atlassian.net/secure/$helpUtil.getHelpPath%28%27help%27%29.url
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk Help menu shows a 404 error

fields.description: The expected behaviour of inserting a duplicate Timed Promise into the database is that the insert function will return 'none()', indicating that nothing changed. This was originally achieved by attempting to insert the timed promise, catching the resultant unique constraint database exception, and then returning 'none()'. A recent change removed this logic, so that instead inserting a duplicate timed promise will cause a unique constraint exception.
fields.summary: Timed Promises Plugin no longer allows inserting duplicate timed promises

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to delete holiday from calendar
h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk version 1000.196.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a JIRA Service Desk project settings
# Click the SLA tab
# Click the Calendar option
# Click the Edit button to edit the calendar
# Scroll down to the Holidays section
# Add a holiday (if this calendar doesn't have one already)
# Click the Delete button

h3. Expected Results
The holiday is deleted
h3. Actual Results
The button has no action what so ever and the holiday isn't deleted

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Unable to delete holiday from calendar
Enabling email in Service Desk error occurs

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to sign up for a Service Desk account or when attempting to invite a customer within a Service Desk with an email address in the format firstname.m.lastname@domain.com, JIRA displays an error that you must enter a valid email address.

h3. Environment

Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project
# Go into the Customers section of the Service Desk
# Click Invite Customers
# Type in any email address in the following format: firstname.m.lastname@domain.com

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should accept the email address

h3. Actual Results

JIRA displays the following error:

!invalidemail.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes

This only effects the email address if there is a single email as the middle initial. If you add at a minimum one additional letter for a total of two, JIRA will accept the email address as valid. This also affects the ability to add customers who have multiple periods to an issue. 

h3.Workaround

The user can manually create the user account using User Management and then make the account a Service Desk Customer account. User Management does not generate the same error that Service Desk is generating.
fields.summary: Customer invite fails when using multiple periods in email address with single letter in between

fields.description:
When a customer creates a request and a agent assigns a watcher to the card whom will receive notifications, it should be visible on the watchers customer portal.
Example - Anita at PSG logs original request
Christo is a colleague and the Lautus agent assigns Christo as the watcher, Christo should be able to see the card on his portal
This currently does not work, it only works if christo is a reporter

Also, is there no way for a customer, ie Anita, so see all requests for that project? as to be able to look for past requests that might be similar to her current request but logged by someone else?

Both of the above are stoppers for us to use service desk as designed
fields.summary: JIRA service desk customer portal does not allow all or watcher requests

fields.description:
*Links* with special characters like apostrophe show raw html entities. (double encoding problem?)

We are using french language with default UFT-8 encoding.

---
In service desk, create a request type with an apostrophe in the name

Now access the service desk portal, you should see that links (or at least some) will display the apostrophe as raw html entities.

For example a link will display

{noformat}
Démande d'aide
{noformat}

instead of
{noformat}
Démande d'aide
{noformat}

This is not great if a stakeholder should access the page and see this.

---
btw, don't know why it says unreleased version below. We are on a cloud instance.
fields.summary: JSD - Portal shows characters as plain unencoded html entities

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*Help and instructions* entered on a Request Type form are not being displayed within the Customer Portal when filling out/viewing the form.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk v3.2.0-OD-03

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Request Type on a JSD project
# Click to Edit fields of the Request Type
# Add content to the *Help and instructions* field
# When saved, click *View this request form* to observe no instructions visible

h3. Expected Results
Help and instructions content entered by project administrator should be visible at the top of the form.

h3. Actual Results
Content is not visible.
 
h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Help and instructions content not visible on Request Type Form

fields.description:
Ladies and Gentlemen,

we are wondering if there is a way to share a certain issue in the Service Desk between Service Desk users.

Background:
One customer discusses an issue with our support team.
We decide that this issue is of general interest and would like to inform other users.

Is that possible somehow?

Cheers
Michael
fields.summary: Share an issue between different Customers

fields.description:
I Want to customize the login page on my Jira On Demand Instance (bgpsupport.atlassian.net) .
I have followed the documentation regarding this problem, and insert a custom LOGO, but this logo do not appear into the login page of my JOD.
Is there something I miss ??
Can you explain how to customize the LOGIN page of a JOD instance, please ??
Regards
P.
fields.summary: Custom login page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to create a new project using shared configuration the project gets created but the settings are all wrong.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA v1000.383.2
 * JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.445.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new IT Service Desk Project (say ProjA)
 # Create a new project using _Create with shared configuration_ from ProjA (say ProjB)

h3. Expected Results

The project should get created using the same settings (workflow, scheme, permission scheme, and screen).
h3. Actual Results

The project is created using: jira default workflow and its own field configuraiton, permissions, etc. This is also creating two workflow schemes associated with the project which is *preventing users from editing the workflow associated with the issue types.* It's possible to see through the Issue types on project configurations.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some text in Customer Portal in French translation are showing wrong characters. An example is shown below:
!french.png|thumbnail!

It seems that some characters, like apostrophes, are replaced by these characters.

This is how the English version of this page looks like:
!english.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have JIRA SD with Default Language as French (and make sure the user has this language in the profile as well)
# Associate a project with a KB in Confluence
# Open Customer Portal for a project
# Click ‘Centre de support’
# Search for something in the search box


h3. Expected Results
All text is correct

h3. Actual Results
This is shown in the bottom:
{noformat}
Aucune n'est ce dont j'ai besoin
{noformat}

When this should be the text:
{noformat}
Aucune n’est ce dont j’ai besoin
{noformat}

Other parts of the Customer Portal show this problem.
 
h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Wrong characters in Customer Portal in French

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to create a service desk request via the customer portal, clicking on the calendar icon next to a date field does not display the date picker. 
If the date/time field is set to use the current date, then no other field will be shown once the form is open.

h3. Environment
Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a service desk request type that includes a date field
# When creating a service desk request, click on the calendar icon next to the date.

Or

# Configure the field to use the current date
# Open a service desk request type that includes that field

h3. Expected Results
Date picker is displayed and a date can be selected.

h3. Actual Results
Date picker is not displayed. The following error is displayed in the browsers development console.

!dev_console_error.png|thumbnail! 

And the following error is shown when the field has default value:
 !Screen Shot 2016-05-04 at 2.36.25 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Enter the date manually using the default jira.date.picker.java.format:  {{dd/MMM/yy}} - i.e. 06/May/16
fields.summary: Date Picker Not Working in Customer Portal

fields.description: If a service desk agent attaches a file in response to a customer reported issue the attached file is not captured in the the customer portal for the respective ticket nor is an e-mail send to notify the customer that an attachment has been added to the ticket
fields.summary: Attachments created by Service Desk Agents are not captured in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h2.Summary

Automation rules in JIRA Service Desk are not working.

Note: The points below apply for the default *Transition on comment* automation rule that gets generated by default at Service Desk project creation. However this bug applies to any newly created automation rule, even customer created ones.

h2.Steps to Replicate
 
# Create a new Basic Service Desk Project.
# Create a new customer.
# Use this customer to create a new issue through Customer Portal.
# Assign this issue and add a comment, the issue should execute the transition *Respond to customer*, but it wont.
# Manually execute the transition *Respond to customer*.
# Access the customer portal as the issues's reporter and add a comment to the issue, the issue should execute the transition *Respond to support*, but it wont.


By default a Basic Service Desk have the automation rule *Transition on comment*
* WHEN *Comment is added to an issue*
* IF *Issue matches: Status = "Waiting for support" / "Customer Request Type" is not empty / Comment is public / User is not a customer*
** THEN *Transition issue: Respond to customer*
* IF ELSE *Issue matches: Status = "Waiting for customer" / "Customer Request Type" is not empty / Comment is public / User is a customer*
** THEN *Transition issue: Respond to support*

h2.Expected Behavior

The automation rule *transition on comment* should execute a transition by adding a comment to the issue.

h2.Current behavior

The automation rule *transition on comment* is not executing the transition when adding a comment.

h2. Additional notes

This can also effect custom automation rules. If support checks in the JIRA database, it may be found that the 'Enabled' column is set to 'F' for the given automation rule. You can see this by running the following query: select * from "AO_9B2E3B_RULE";
fields.summary: Newly created automation rules are not working in Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users who are members of administration groups and doesn't have a JIRA license won't have permission to projects on Customer Portal.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA v1000.870.3
 * JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.1111.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add user to jira-administration groups
 # Add user to a JSD project it to Administrator role
 # Remove his licenses to JIRA (Service Desk, Core and Software)
 # Login as the user and open Customer Portal

h3. Expected Results

User will be able to view the project on portal
h3. Actual Results

{{You do not have permission to view this Portal.}}
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround
Remove user with no product access from group jira-administration
fields.summary: Administrators without JIRA access cannot access portal

fields.description:
Request types are disabled, whenever there is a chance that 'Create Request' for that request type would fail.

E.g. Field configuration of the related issue type has a field which is marked required, un-supported on portal yet, and is not allocated a default value yet. 

SD tries to fore-warn Service Desk admins by showing them a warning, and disables the request types.

This functionality seems to be broken.
fields.summary: Service Desk does not disable the request types whose configuration may be broke.

fields.description:
We are about to launch Jira Service Desk, and have just rolled out the Testing Phase with selected customers. And almost immediately there are complaints on the Password policy Settings.

I have checked a similar issue {color:red}JSD-1534{color}, and this is definately a Variation of it.

This is the Problem description:
# Customer tries to create an new Login account
# Password is +rejected+
# Customer uses a different password
# Account is successfully created
# Customer goes to "Profile Setting", and changed the Password to the one that was rejected in the first place.
# Password is +accepted+.

Could you please check asap? It sounds like a Variation of the similar bug.
fields.summary: Contradictory Password Policy

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Start a Cloud instance with Service Desk on 1.0 pricing (non-agent-based).
# Try to create a new Automation rule of type "Re-open on customer comment".

The "IF" portion of the rule will say "Unknown module: com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:sd-comment-visibility-if-condition".

!sd.png!

h3. Workaround
Select the "IF" and delete the unknown module line. On an instance with agent-based pricing, that line is a "Comment is public" type.
fields.summary: "Re-open on customer comment" automation blueprint reports "Unknown module" in IF when running without agent-based pricing

h3. Summary
The user avatar is not displaying correctly in the profile page of the customer portal.

h3. Step to reproduce:

-- Log in with any user account in JIRA
-- Go to Profile page in JIRA
-- Change avatar with one of provided avatars 
-- Go to Customer Portal
-- Open Profile page

h3. Expected Results
The avatar should render correctly in all browsers

h3. Actual Results
The avatar of user - the one next to their username - the first one in the page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Eventually, some Service Desk notifications might stop working, and customers will not receive updates from their tickets. That will cause communication issues between the SD Agent and the customer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a ticket via portal

h3. Expected Results
You receive the mail confirmation that the issue has been created

No notification is sent.

h3. Notes
Also happens to other Service Desk notification events, like issue commented and issue resolved.

Affected version: 1000.621.0

Ask Atlassian Support to apply the workaround.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Previously in JIRA Service Desk Cloud, users were able to set their own custom greeting in their user profile preferences. This functionality is described further in the resolved issue: [JSD-2257|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-2257]. 

With the most recent release of JSD to Cloud, that functionality no longer exists. Previously, when viewing user profile, users should be able to configure this setting under the Service Desk Preferences, however that option no longer exists. 

h3. Environment
This is observed in JIRA Service Desk v3.2.0-OD-15-001

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA Service Desk Cloud as an Agent
# Visit your user profile in JIRA
# Look for JIRA Service Desk Preferences

h3. Expected Results
You should see a place to configure your message greetings
h3. Actual Results
The option does not exist on the profile page. 

h3.Workaround
There is currently no workaround.
fields.summary: Agent greeting is missing in comments/email notifications

Keep Me Logged In tick-box not working in Customer Portal
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Service Desk 3.3.0-OD-1000.964.0
 * Chrome
 * Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to Customer portal with "Keep me logged in" Tickbox is ticked.
 # Perform some actions in portal.
 # Close down browser.

h3. Expected Results

!cookies.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Keep me logged in is not working for Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a customer belongs to multiple organizations, the Open request column in the Customer page includes requests reported by the customer in other organizations too.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Version - 1000.745.0 Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two organizations and add one customer to both organizations
 # Create request in one of the organizations

h3. Expected Results

Open request column shows an increment in number of request created for the organization where the request was created
h3. Actual Results

Open request column shows an increment in number of requests created for both organizations
h3. Notes

The current JQL shows as
{code:java}
reporter in organizationMembers("Organization Name") AND resolution = Unresolved AND project = PROJECTKEY AND "Customer Request Type" is not EMPTY{code}
instead of
{code:java}
Organizations in ("Organization Name") AND resolution = Unresolved AND project = PROJECTKEY AND "Customer Request Type" is not EMPTY{code}
h3. Workaround

No workaround at the moment. Would need to create a manual filter to display the desired result.
fields.summary: Organization Open Request in Customer page displays wrong request number if customer belongs to multiple organizations

Non-Service Desk issues are being auto transitioned from the Reporter making comments. See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-108901 for more details of the scenario.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a Confluence site and space have been set to allow anonymous access then in JIRA Service Desk it'll be possible to view the page if you are a logged in user without Confluence access. However, any attachments on that page will not be visible.

h3. Environment
* JSD v2.6.0-OD-02-001-D20150616T012333
* Confluence Cloud 5.9.0-OD-55-030

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user that has access to JIRA and is only in the jira-users group
# Connect a service desk with a Confluence space
# Set up the Confluence space to allow anonymous access
# Set up the Confluence site to allow anonymous access
# In the connected Confluence space create a page and attach an image, then embed that image on the page.
# Get the user in step 1 to access the Customer Portal and search for the page in Step 5.

h3. Expected Results

Full page including attachments are displayed

h3. Actual Results

Only the text of the page is displayed, no embedded images or documents attached to the page will display.
 
h3.Workaround

If the user is a JIRA Service Desk 'Customer' then they will be able to view the attachments. Alternatively you'll need to give the user Confluence Application Access.

If you are on JIRA Service Desk 1 Pricing Model then you'll need to [move to the version 2 pricing model|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/Upgrading+to+JIRA+Service+Desk+2.0+and+moving+to+the+version+2+pricing+model] in order to allow 'Customer' access.
fields.summary: JIRA Users unable to view attachments on Confluence KBs without Confluence global permission

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to specify the same "Cloud Email Address" that had previously been in use on a service desk project that existed prior to the JIRA Service Desk instance being reset. This only applies to cases where the instance had been previously reset and where a "Cloud Email Address" is used. 

*Example:*
 * The instance has an existing service desk project
 * The service desk project has the email address: "support@instance.atlassian.net" configured on the project
 * The instance is reset
 * A new service desk project is created, and there is a need to use "support@instancename.atlassian.net" as the "Cloud Email Address"
 * When attempting to change the configured email address, an error message is displayed: "The email address you entered is currently used by another service desk." (see screenshot below)

!Screen Shot 2017-03-09 at 3.34.29 PM.png|width=850,height=354!
h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk 3.3.0-OD-1000.1015.2

JIRA 1000.815.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce

_Prerequisites:_
 * You have an existing service desk project on an instance that was reset
 * You want to create a new service desk project, but want to use a "Cloud Email Address" that was used in a project that is no longer existing

 # Create a new service desk project.  The project is created but has been configured with a "Cloud Email Address" that is different to the one you'd like to use.
 # Change the configured Cloud email address, to the desired email address. 

h3. Expected Results

"Your changes were saved successfully."
h3. Actual Results

Error message: "The email address you entered is currently used by another service desk." (see screenshot in Summary)  
h3. Notes
 * Bug can only be reproduced on instances that have been reset and if a "Cloud Email Address" is configured

h3. Workaround

Contact support for a workaround. Reference this ticket in your description.
fields.summary: Cloud Email Address: Email address you entered is currently used by another service desk

fields.description:
When I select a drop down in the Create a Service Desk Request screen, and then click the back button on the browser (or mouse), the drop-down box (<div>) remains visible.

Reproducible on https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23
and Cloud instances.
fields.summary: Drop-down box remains visible after clicking the back button

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While the StatusPage add-on for JSD is enabled, the option inside of Service Desk to 'Raise a request' does not function properly. Clicking that button will open the overlay, but it will be empty and no customer information can be entered.
h3. Environment

JIRA Service Desk Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the StatusPage for JSD add-on for Cloud ([https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/jsd-status-page/cloud/overview])
 # As an agent, go to queue view and choose *Raise a request* from the left hand navigation panel

h3. Expected Results

The customer portal overlay loads on top of the page and you are able to select a request.
h3. Actual Results

The customer portal overlays loads but shows a blank page and there is no possibility to raise a request.

!image-2017-01-26-20-20-53-719.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Accessing the portal URL in a separate browser window allows you to access the portal with no issues. 

If you strictly need to use *Raise a request* feature from inside the JSD project, then the only workaround is to disable the StatusPage add-on.
fields.summary: Enabling StatusPage for JSD add-on breaks the project 'Raise a request' option

fields.description:
h2.Summary
When you set notification email as an action in an automation rule and set it to be triggered by a specific user, the notification is still shown as sent by the user who triggered the notification (not the configured user).

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create SD project
# Create an automation rule much like the customers, only status in IF is Waiting for Customer and notification message is different
# Make sure the Run as project default option is selected
# Create a user and set it as the default event user
# Create a ticket with a user with my email
# Trigger the automation rule via triggering the transition with yet another user (third user, sysadmin)
# Check which user is used in email

h2.Expected Result
Notification should be sent as the configured user.

h2.Current Result
Notification is sent by the user who triggered the notification.
fields.summary: Automation notification is not triggered by default user even though if configured as such

fields.description:
h2.Summary

When cancelling edit issue screen, browser will display a pop-up message stating that there are changes have been made even though no changes made to the issue.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Create a new Service Desk issue and save 
# Click on *Edit* button but do not change anything
# Click on *Cancel*
# Browser will display the pop up message

h2.Expected Behavior

The edit issue pop-up should close without any warnings

h2.Current behavior

Pop up message displays:
 !popup.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Incorrect pop-up message displayed when editing issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Google Sync (G Suite) Customers can be enabled for "Restricted Portal Access"

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Sync users with Google Apps
# Users that was synced will appear in https://<url>.atlassian.net/projects/SERV/customers as Customers
# Click on any user > Administer user (It will bring to the user management screen)
# User will have no application access and "Restricted Portal Access" is disabled by default
# Click on "Restricted Portal Access" checkbox to enabled
# Customer user is now enabled with "Restricted Portal Access" 

h3. Expected Results
# Customer user that was synced from Google Apps should not have an option to enable "Restricted Portal Access"

h3. Actual Results
# Administrator should not have an option to enable "Restricted Portal Access" when the users are synced with Google Apps

h3. Notes
- N/A

h3.Workaround
Do not enable the "Restricted Portal Access"  for Google Sync Users
fields.summary: Google Sync (G Suite) Customers can be enabled for "Restricted Portal Access"

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Help and Instructions in the request type cannot be saved. New request type will have empty Help and Instructions and available values cannot be changed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Request Type section in project configuration. Select Edit Fields
# Edit the value for Help and Instructions

h3. Expected Results
New value saved
h3. Actual Results
New value not saved
Console showing a 404 error
 
h3.Workaround
No workarounds at the moment
fields.summary: Request type Help and instructions cannot be saved

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
Please see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-2278?focusedCommentId=783182
{panel}


Since Release 31st August 2015, Emails not Created from Service Desk Emails

*Symptom*

Emails sent to email channel defined in the email setting for the Service Desk, but no issue created. 

Testing connection seems fine.


*Disclaimer*

We are still investigating the root cause of this issue, please watch this bug ticket to get the latest update time to time.

*Environment Details*
* Version for JEPP: {{1.0.42-D20150820T044232}}
* So far tested, it affects both internal mail (mailstore) and external mail
* It only affects JIRA Cloud instances
fields.summary: Since Release 31st August 2015, Tickets not Created from Service Desk Emails
Error Encountered When Trying to Enable Email in Service Desk

fields.description:
*Case:*
After Mar-29th release, once a user activate JSD and tries to create a new SD the following error message shows up:
{code} There was a problem creating Automation rules for this new Service Desk{code}
!createSDerror.png|thumbnail!

*JIRA Log:*
{code}Unable to access module for descriptor 'com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.servicedesk-automation-modules-plugin:servicedesk-commented-automation-rule-event-when-handler' of class 'com.atlassian.servicedesk.plugins.automation.internal.descriptors.EventWhenHandlerModuleDescriptor' because of 'com.atlassian.util.concurrent.LazyReference$InitializationException - java.lang.NullPointerException'{code}

*Versions:*
JIRA v6.4-OD-16-006
JIRA Service Desk v2.4-OD-05-001

*Workaround:*
Restart JIRA. For Cloud applications, raise a ticket on support.atlassian.com that a support engineer will perform that.
fields.summary: Error when installing/activating JSD after Mar-29th release

fields.description:
When configuring JIRA Service desk to force customer sign-in, there is also an invitation sent for Bitbucket account.

By default DVCS is configured to automatically send invitations to new users, Here is the documentation for [Configuring Automatic Team Invites to Bitbucket | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Configure+Automatic+Team+Invites]. This describes the process for adding groups from JIRA to the list on invitees in Bitbucket.

h3.Expected Behavior
Users created by Service Desk should not be receiving invites to Bitbucket.

h3.Actual Behavior
They are receiving an invite to Bitbucket and giving the users with developers or administrators access.

h3.Workaround
# As Administrator go to: https://<Instance Name HERE>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ConfigureDvcsOrganizations!default.jspa
# Click the cog menu and select Configure automatic access and deselect Developers and/or Administrators.
# Moving forward you will have to manually send invitations to new users.
fields.summary: User creation in JIRA Service Desk created invitation to Bitbucket

fields.description:
h2.Summary

Any attachments (other than images) in notification email redirects to portal when clicked.

h2.Steps to reproduce

# Attach file to an issue
# Send a comment including the link., {{[^example.txt]}}.
# Check notification e-mail and click on the link provided

h2.Expected behavior

Clicking on the attachment link should trigger a download of the file.

h2.Current behavior

Attachment link triggers a redirection to the customer portal instead of direct access.
fields.summary: Non-image attachments in comment notifications redirects to portal login

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Go to Service Desk Customer portal
# Click on Forgotten password link
# Enter the username and click on email me button.
# Check your inbox for the reset password email and click on the link provided in the email
# Enter details into change password form. Hit submit.

*Expected Behaviour*
User will be able to access the customer portal with the new password

*Actual Behaviour*
Password reset error returns and claims password fields left empty. Which they are not empty at submission time.

*Workaround*
Use the JIRA's Reset Password link. (<instance>/login/forgot)
fields.summary: Password reset not working for Service Desk Customer in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create an SLA with a goal (can match "all remaining issues") with a defined target duration
# Create an issue that triggers the SLA start condition
# Have the SLA breach
# Meet the stop condition of the SLA (to complete the SLA)
# Modify the SLA target to have no duration.
# Attempt to run the reconstruction endpoint: <baseUrl>/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/sla/admin/task/destructive/reconstruct?force=false on the issue above (giving the issue key in the body).

h3. Expected results
The reconstruction should ignore the SLA with an undefined target duration.

h3. Actual results
A Null Pointer Exception is thrown and the SLAs are not constructed for any valid SLAs that are run after the one that triggers the exception.
fields.summary: SLA Reconstruction throws a Null Pointer Exception if the issue matches an SLA goal with no target duration defined.

fields.description:
On a production instance of Version:
3.2.0-OD-13-003-D20160519T031557: 
1. On a JSD issue, click into the comment box. 
2. Paste a screenshot. Another dialog opens up. The paste should go into the comment box. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
3. If I cancel the dialog, the screenshot still shows as visible in the underlying comment box, but when I save, the attachment can't be rendered.
  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
4. If I save the dialog by clicking 'share with customer', then only the attachment is visible on the comment and the notification would only contain the attachment, which is not what I want either.
fields.summary: Copy and paste screenshots in a comment box opens another dialog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
SD doesn't add CC-ed user through email as Request Participant.

h3. Environment
* JSD Cloud version {{3.3.0-OD-1000.881.0}}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket from customer portal
# Assign it to an agent 
# Get the agent to reply to the email notification received from SD and a user who has access to the SD project on the CC field

h3. Expected Results
User added in Step 3 should be added as a _Request Participant_ on the ticket.

h3. Actual Results
User is not added as a _Request Participant_ on the ticket and the email reply is added as a comment.
 
h3.Workaround
* Manually add users as _Request Participants_.

h3. Notes
According to the [Adding Request Participants documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/adding-request-participants-732528959.html], users should be added as _Request Participant_ when added in the CC field.
fields.summary: SD doesn't add CC-ed user through email as Request Participant

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Service Desk enables administrator of a project to change the default user to run an automation rule.
If the default user for project's automation is changed, the automation will not work and on the automation page it still shows as System Administrator

 !Screen Shot 2015-11-13 at 9.43.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
*  JIRA version 7.0.0-OD-08
* JIRA Service Desk version 3.1.0-OD-03

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the user that automation rules will run as (other user than System Administrator)
# Create an automation to *Be aware of urgent issues*
# Rules :
#* When Issue created
#* Issue matches priority in (Blocker,Critical)
#* Alert User (any_user)
# Run as project default (any_user)
# Create a blocker/critical issue through customer portal

h3. Expected Results
User mentioned is alerted through notifications
h3. Actual Results
# User mentioned is not alerted through notifications
# Run as project default (any user) instead of Run as project default (System Administrator)
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Run query 
{code}select ao."ID" ,ao."USER_KEY", p.pkey, p.pname from "AO_9B2E3B_PROJECT_USER_CONTEXT" ao, project p where ao."PROJECT_ID" = p.id;{code}

For example :
{noformat}
ID |  USER_KEY   |  pkey  |             pname
----+-------------+--------+-------------------------------
